name: Twat
body:
### Using Twat
twat is a cli interface to ruby.

A common example would be:

```
$ gem install twat
$ twat add [twitter handle]
$ twat "This is a tweet from me"
$ twat # This will put twat into follow mode
```

### Authors and Contributors
Written by @richoH, still massively in progress and open to contributions, even if it's just a vague whine in a [github issue](https://github.com/richoH/twat/issues)
tagline: A CLI frontend to twitter, implemented in ruby.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
